key_points: Thousands paid tribute to U.S. Marine Lance Cpl. Kareem Grant Nikoui in Norco, California.
Nikoui died in the Kabul airport bombing on Aug. 26, which killed 13 U.S. service members and over 100 Afghans.
A "Fallen Hero Procession" escorted Nikoui's remains from Ontario International Airport to Crestlawn Mortuary.
A funeral for Nikoui is planned for Saturday.
Remembrance ceremonies are also being held for another local Marine, Cpl. Hunter Lopez, who died in the same attack.
People lined the streets to honor Nikoui's sacrifice, expressing a sense of duty to pay respects.
The procession drew people of all ages, including veterans who expressed outrage and sadness at the loss.
The attack has also sparked discussions about the security and consequences of the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan.
Nikoui was providing security during the evacuation efforts when he was killed.
The community's participation reflected broad support and mourning for the fallen Marine.
